resource_dependency.browsePageLayout: Ivory background with forest green UI blocks

function: Display a list of promotions in a responsive grid layout with search and filtering capabilities.
static_description: The page displays an ivory-colored outer container with a header containing the site logo and navigation links. Below is a search bar with a forest green border and a search icon. A filter dropdown allows selection by category. Promotions are displayed in a responsive grid of cards featuring a placeholder image, title, description, discount value, validity period, and share button with share icons.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the search button or pressing Enter after typing in the search bar triggers a promotion search based on keywords.
Selecting a category from the dropdown filters promotions by that category.
Clicking a share button opens a modal with social media icons and a copyable link to the promotion.

resource_dependency.sharePageLayout: Ivory background with forest green form container

function: Allow authenticated users to submit new promotions through a form interface.
static_description: A dedicated page with an ivory background featuring a centered forest green form block. The form includes labeled input fields for promotion title, description, category dropdown, discount value, start/end dates, and terms and conditions. Submit and cancel buttons are positioned below the form.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Submit Promotion' validates all fields and sends the data to the backend API to create a new promotion entry.
Clicking 'Cancel' clears the form and redirects to the browse promotions page.

resource_dependency.promotionDatabaseSchema: Table 'promotions' with columns: id (UUID), title (string), description (text), category (string), discount_value (string), start_date (date), end_date (date), terms_conditions (text), created_by (foreign key to users.id), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.userDatabaseSchema: Table 'users' with columns: id (UUID), username (string), email (string), password_hash (string), role (enum: admin/user), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.settingsDatabaseSchema: Table 'website_settings' with columns: id (primary key), setting_key (string), setting_value (text)

function: Provide persistent storage for promotions, user accounts, and website configurations using PostgreSQL.
static_description: A PostgreSQL database schema defined with three tables: 'promotions', 'users', and 'website_settings'. Each table contains fields relevant to storing promotion data, user credentials and roles, and customizable website parameters. Connection established using environment variables DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME.

function: Secure access to the administrative backend through user authentication.
static_description: A login page accessible at /admin/login featuring a centered forest green card on an ivory background. The card contains fields for email and password, along with a 'Login' button. Invalid credentials display an error message beneath the form.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Login' button sends credentials to the /api/auth/login endpoint. On success, stores JWT in localStorage and redirects to /admin/dashboard. On failure, shows error message.

function: Enable administrators to perform CRUD operations on promotions through a dedicated management interface.
static_description: An admin dashboard section listing all promotions in a table format. Each row includes promotion details and action icons for editing and deleting. A 'Create New Promotion' button leads to the creation form.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the edit icon navigates to the promotion edit form pre-filled with current data.
Clicking the delete icon prompts a confirmation dialog. Confirming deletes the promotion via DELETE request to /api/admin/promotions/:id.
Clicking 'Create New Promotion' navigates to the blank promotion creation form.

function: Provide an interface for administrators to view, modify, and remove user accounts.
static_description: A tab within the admin dashboard displaying a table of registered users with their details. Action buttons allow changing user roles or deleting accounts. Pagination controls appear below the table for large datasets.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the role dropdown in a user row allows changing the user's role between 'admin' and 'user'.
Clicking the delete button prompts a confirmation before removing the user account via DELETE request to /api/admin/users/:id.

function: Allow administrators to configure global website settings through a simple control panel.
static_description: A configuration panel in the admin area showing input fields for various site settings such as site title, contact email, and default promotion categories. A 'Save Changes' button appears below the form.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Save Changes' sends updated settings to /api/admin/settings endpoint to update the website_settings table.

resource_dependency.noResultsMessage: No promotions found matching your criteria.

function: Enable users to find specific promotions using keyword searches and category filters.
static_description: Integrated search functionality on the main promotions page with a search input field and optional filters. Results dynamically update without page reload. Displays 'No results' message when no matches are found.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing in the search box updates the query parameter sent to /api/promotions/search in real-time or upon submission.
Changing filter options modifies the search parameters sent to the backend API.

resource_dependency.shareModalContent: Social media buttons and direct link input field

function: Facilitate easy sharing of promotions across social platforms and through direct URL copying.
static_description: A modal window appearing when clicking a promotion's share button. Contains branded icons for major social networks and a read-only input field showing the direct link to the promotion.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a social media icon opens the respective platform's sharing dialog with the promotion URL pre-filled.
Clicking the copy link button copies the promotion URL to the clipboard and shows a confirmation tooltip.

resource_dependency.responsiveDesignFramework: CSS Grid and Flexbox with media queries

function: Ensure consistent appearance and usability across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
static_description: A fully responsive design implementing CSS Grid and Flexbox layouts. Outer containers use ivory (#FFFFF0) backgrounds while inner UI blocks utilize forest green (#228B22) styling. Media queries adjust element sizes and stacking at 768px and 480px breakpoints.

interaction_and_states.description: Resizing the browser window adjusts layout elements according to defined breakpoints, ensuring optimal viewing experience on all devices.

resource_dependency.httpStatusCodes: Standard REST status codes (200 OK, 201 Created, 400 Bad Request, 404 Not Found, etc.)

function: Expose standardized HTTP endpoints for interacting with promotion data programmatically.
static_description: Defined RESTful API routes enabling clients to retrieve lists of promotions, create new entries, update existing ones, delete records, and search content using standard HTTP methods and URI patterns.

resource_dependency.errorResponseFormat: { error: { code: string, message: string, details: array } }
resource_dependency.inputSanitization: Remove HTML tags and escape special characters

function: Validate incoming data and provide meaningful feedback for erroneous requests.
static_description: Server-side validation middleware checking required fields, data types, and formats for all POST and PUT requests. Malformed or invalid submissions return structured JSON error responses indicating specific issues.

resource_dependency.concurrentDevScript: concurrently "npm run dev --prefix frontend" "npm run dev --prefix backend"

function: Run both frontend and backend services simultaneously during local development.
static_description: NPM script configured in root package.json that uses the 'concurrently' package to execute separate frontend and backend development servers in parallel when running 'npm run dev'.

interaction_and_states.description: Running 'npm run dev' initiates both frontend build tool (e.g., webpack-dev-server) and backend server (e.g., nodemon) concurrently in the same terminal session.

resource_dependency.installAllScript: npm install --prefix frontend && npm install --prefix backend

function: Simplify dependency installation across frontend and backend projects with a single command.
static_description: Root-level package.json file containing a custom script named 'install:all' which sequentially runs npm install commands in both frontend and backend directories.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run install:all' installs all required Node.js packages for both client-side and server-side applications automatically.

function: Serve static assets like images, fonts, and HTML files directly from the filesystem.
static_description: Backend Express server configured with express.static middleware pointing to the frontend public directory. This serves all static files under root paths without requiring dynamic processing.
